24903101.trustfund:
TF092980-GUINEA-BISSAU - EMERGENCY FOOD
            SECURITY SUPPORT PROJECT,TF092979-GUINEA-BISSAU - EMERGENCY FOOD
            SECURITY SUPPORT PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Guinea-Bissau - Emergency Food Security
            Response Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Food Security
            Response Project for Guinea-Bissau were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, risk to development outcome was high,
            Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance
            was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: country
            ownership ensures achievement of development objectives,
            particularly in fragile countries where government
            leadership is lacking. The involvement of national
            non-governmental organizations (NGOs) in providing technical
            assistance and on the-job training to producer groups
            increases the likelihood of continued capacity building and
            guarantees that new development management skills stay in
            the communities that need those most. Capacity constraints
            in fragile countries are persistent; they often negatively
            affect results and must be properly mitigated during design
            - not just implementation. The new global food crisis
            response program (GFRP) project, currently being formulated,
            has taken under advisement the lessons related to persistent
            weak capacity and will rely heavily on world food program
            (WFP) for implementation, monitoring and evaluation (M and
            E), and fiduciary management. A minimum set of project
            readiness conditions, coupled with intense implementation
            support, is necessary for emergency operations to succeed.

repnme.cdata!:
Guinea Bissau - Food Price Crisis Response
            Trust Fund Program Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Food Price Crisis
            Response Trust Fund Program Project for Guinea Bissau is to
            improve food security for the most vulnerable population,
            including children, and increase smallholder rice production
            in project areas. The closing date of the project will be
            extended from December 31, 2012 to June 30, 2013. The
            extension of the closing date is necessary for the following
            reasons: first, as a precautionary measure in light of the
            current exceptional circumstances in the country. Due to the
            occurrence of a military coup in Guinea-Bissau on April 12,
            2012, bank policy was triggered and the Bank has put
            disbursements of all existing operations on hold. The
            extension is motivated due to the extraordinary
            circumstances in the country and as a precautionary measure,
            in order to give time to the Bank to assess the situation.

repnme.cdata!:
Guinea Bissau - Food Price Crisis Response
            Trust Fund Program Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
This paper reports on the development
            objective of the Food Price Crisis Response Trust Fund
            Program Project for Guinea Bissau, which is to improve food
            security for the most vulnerable population, including
            children, and increase smallholder rice production in
            project areas. The project will be part of said assessment,
            and when resumption of communication is determined, the team
            will seek formal validation of the extension and preparation
            of the action plan. Guinea-Bissau is a fragile country, and
            the international community has already warned about
            aggravation of the food crisis in light of the coup. Once
            the assessment is complete, a rapid re-engagement of project
            implementation will contribute to alleviate the problem. The
            project's objectives are still achievable, and there
            are key implementation actions to be completed. Supervision
            is still ongoing to the extent possible. Due to the fact
            that the Bank is still assessing the situation and has not
            resumed communications with the government, there is
            currently no request from government to extend the project.
            The extension is motivated due to the extraordinary
            circumstances in the country, and as a precautionary
            measure, in order to give time to the Bank to assess the
            situation. The project development objectives are still
            achievable and, as indicated, there is still money to be
            disbursed to complete the procurement and payment of
            critical goods.

repnme.cdata!:
Guinea-Bissau - Emergency Food Security
            Support Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of this Emergency Food
            Security Support Project for Guinea-Bissau is to improve
            food security for the most vulnerable population, including
            children, and increase smallholder rice production in
            project areas. The extension of the closing date is
            necessary for the following reasons: First, there has been
            some delay in the procurement of critical goods (e.g. rice
            mills, millet mills and power tillers) since the borrower
            had to procure these goods from European and/or Asian
            countries. Second, the borrower requires additional time
            since some of the equipment needs to be tested on arrival
            and delivered to the beneficiaries, who, in turn, need to be
            trained in the efficient and safe use of the equipment which
            will take additional time. Furthermore, the closing date
            needs to be extended in order to allow adequate time for the
            completion of all project activities to assist farmers
            involved in rice production.

            Security Support Project : restructuring  (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
